intro: Durandea jenkinsii, commonly known as the Jenkins' durandea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes a wide variety of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its simple, opposite leaves and clusters of small, white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist, shaded habitats such as forests or along riverbanks. Due to its limited distribution and specific ecological requirements, it is considered a rare and potentially endangered species.
